title: Jonah Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Jonah with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 4 chapters.

questions.question: Who was Jonah's father?
questions.correctAnswer: Amittai
questions.explanation: Jonah is introduced as the son of Amittai in Jonah 1:1.

questions.question: What city was Jonah commanded by God to go to and preach against?
questions.correctAnswer: Nineveh
questions.explanation: God commanded Jonah to go to Nineveh to cry against it for their wickedness.

questions.question: Where did Jonah try to flee to escape God's command?
questions.correctAnswer: Tarshish
questions.explanation: Jonah fled to Tarshish to escape the presence of the LORD.

questions.question: What caused the great tempest at sea while Jonah was on the ship?
options: The LORD sent a great wind
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD sent a great wind
questions.explanation: The LORD sent out a great wind into the sea causing a mighty tempest.

questions.question: What were the sailors doing when the storm hit the sea?
options: Crying unto their gods and casting cargo into the sea
questions.correctAnswer: Crying unto their gods and casting cargo into the sea
questions.explanation: The mariners cried every man unto his god and cast forth the wares to lighten the ship.

questions.question: Where was Jonah during the storm on the ship?
options: Fast asleep in the sides of the ship
questions.correctAnswer: Fast asleep in the sides of the ship
questions.explanation: Jonah had gone down into the sides of the ship and was fast asleep.

questions.question: What method did the sailors use to determine the cause of the storm?
questions.correctAnswer: Casting lots
questions.explanation: They cast lots to find out for whose cause the evil was upon them.

questions.question: What was Jonah's nationality and religious belief?
options: Hebrew; feared the LORD God of heaven
questions.correctAnswer: Hebrew; feared the LORD God of heaven
questions.explanation: Jonah declared he was a Hebrew and feared the LORD God of heaven.

questions.question: What did Jonah tell the sailors to do to calm the sea?
options: Take him up and cast him into the sea
questions.correctAnswer: Take him up and cast him into the sea
questions.explanation: Jonah said casting him forth into the sea would calm the sea.

questions.question: What happened to the sea after Jonah was thrown overboard?
options: The sea ceased from her raging
questions.correctAnswer: The sea ceased from her raging
questions.explanation: After Jonah was cast into the sea, the sea ceased from its raging.

questions.question: What did the sailors do after the sea calmed?
options: Feared the LORD exceedingly and offered a sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: Feared the LORD exceedingly and offered a sacrifice
questions.explanation: The men feared the LORD exceedingly and made vows and sacrifices.

questions.question: What creature swallowed Jonah?
questions.correctAnswer: A great fish
questions.explanation: God prepared a great fish to swallow Jonah.

questions.question: How long was Jonah in the belly of the great fish?
questions.correctAnswer: Three days and three nights
questions.explanation: Jonah was in the fish's belly for three days and three nights.

questions.question: From where did Jonah pray unto the LORD in chapter 2?
questions.correctAnswer: Out of the fish's belly
questions.explanation: Jonah prayed unto the LORD from inside the fish's belly.

questions.question: Complete the prayer: 'Out of the belly of hell cried I, and _____ heardest my voice.'
questions.correctAnswer: Thou
questions.explanation: Jonah says, 'Out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice.'

questions.question: What did Jonah say he would sacrifice with the voice of thanksgiving?
questions.correctAnswer: That which I have vowed
questions.explanation: Jonah vowed to sacrifice with thanksgiving that which he had promised.

questions.question: According to Jonah's prayer, from what did God bring up his life?
questions.correctAnswer: Corruption
questions.explanation: Jonah acknowledges God brought his life up from corruption.

questions.question: What did the LORD command the fish to do after Jonah's prayer?
options: Vomit Jonah upon the dry land
questions.correctAnswer: Vomit Jonah upon the dry land
questions.explanation: God commanded the fish to vomit Jonah upon the dry land.

questions.question: How many times did the word of the LORD come to Jonah to go to Nineveh?
questions.correctAnswer: Twice
questions.explanation: The word of the LORD came the second time to Jonah to go to Nineveh.

questions.question: How large was the city of Nineveh described in Jonah 3?
options: An exceeding great city of three days' journey
A city of one day's walk
questions.correctAnswer: An exceeding great city of three days' journey
questions.explanation: Nineveh was described as a great city covering three days' journey.

questions.question: What message did Jonah preach to Nineveh?
options: Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown
questions.correctAnswer: Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown
questions.explanation: Jonah proclaimed that in forty days Nineveh would be overthrown.

questions.question: How did the people of Nineveh respond to Jonah's preaching?
options: They believed God, proclaimed a fast, and put on sackcloth
questions.correctAnswer: They believed God, proclaimed a fast, and put on sackcloth
questions.explanation: The people repented and fasted in response to Jonah's message.

questions.question: What did the king of Nineveh do when he heard the message?
options: Arose from his throne, put on sackcloth, and sat in ashes
questions.correctAnswer: Arose from his throne, put on sackcloth, and sat in ashes
questions.explanation: The king humbled himself in sackcloth and ashes.

questions.question: What did the king's decree include regarding food and drink?
options: Neither man nor beast should taste anything or drink water
questions.correctAnswer: Neither man nor beast should taste anything or drink water
questions.explanation: The king commanded that man and beast should not eat or drink.

questions.question: What condition did the king and people of Nineveh call upon God to consider?
options: If God would turn from his fierce anger
If God would send a prophet
If God would destroy the city
If God would bless their crops
questions.correctAnswer: If God would turn from his fierce anger
questions.explanation: They hoped God would relent and not bring destruction.

questions.question: What was God's reaction to Nineveh's repentance?
options: God repented of the evil and did not destroy the city
questions.correctAnswer: God repented of the evil and did not destroy the city
questions.explanation: God saw their repentance and spared the city.

questions.question: How did Jonah feel about God sparing Nineveh?
options: He was exceedingly displeased and very angry
questions.correctAnswer: He was exceedingly displeased and very angry
questions.explanation: Jonah was angry because God showed mercy to Nineveh.

questions.question: Why did Jonah say he fled to Tarshish originally?
options: Because he knew God was gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and would relent
Because he was afraid of Nineveh's people
questions.correctAnswer: Because he knew God was gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and would relent
questions.explanation: Jonah fled because he anticipated God's mercy.

questions.question: What did Jonah request from the LORD in his prayer in chapter 4?
options: Take my life; it is better to die than to live
questions.correctAnswer: Take my life; it is better to die than to live
questions.explanation: Jonah wished to die rather than live after his anger.

questions.question: Where did Jonah sit to watch the fate of Nineveh?
options: On the east side of the city under a booth
questions.correctAnswer: On the east side of the city under a booth
questions.explanation: Jonah made a booth and sat under it to see what would happen.

questions.question: What did God prepare to give Jonah shade?
questions.correctAnswer: A gourd
questions.explanation: God prepared a gourd to come up over Jonah for shade.

questions.question: What happened to the gourd the next day?
options: A worm smote it and it withered
It was cut down by men
questions.correctAnswer: A worm smote it and it withered
questions.explanation: God prepared a worm that caused the gourd to wither.

questions.question: What natural elements afflicted Jonah after the gourd withered?
options: A vehement east wind and the sun beating on his head
questions.correctAnswer: A vehement east wind and the sun beating on his head
questions.explanation: Jonah was faint from the sun and east wind after the gourd died.

questions.question: What question did God ask Jonah about his anger?
options: Doest thou well to be angry?
questions.correctAnswer: Doest thou well to be angry?
questions.explanation: God asked Jonah if it was right for him to be angry.

questions.question: What reason did God give for sparing Nineveh?
options: There are more than sixscore thousand persons who cannot discern their right hand from their left
No one in Nineveh was wicked
questions.correctAnswer: There are more than sixscore thousand persons who cannot discern their right hand from their left
questions.explanation: God emphasized the many innocent people and animals in Nineveh.

questions.question: True or False: Jonah immediately obeyed God's command to go to Nineveh the first time he received it.
questions.correctAnswer: false
questions.explanation: Jonah fled to Tarshish instead of going to Nineveh initially.

questions.question: True or False: The sailors recognized Jonah as the cause of the storm after casting lots.
questions.correctAnswer: true
questions.explanation: The lot fell on Jonah, revealing he was the cause.

questions.question: True or False: Jonah was swallowed by a whale according to the KJV text.
questions.correctAnswer: false
questions.explanation: The KJV uses 'great fish', not whale.

questions.question: True or False: Jonah declared that salvation is of the LORD in his prayer from the fish.
questions.correctAnswer: true
questions.explanation: Jonah stated 'Salvation is of the LORD' in Jonah 2:9.

questions.question: True or False: Nineveh was a small village according to the book of Jonah.
questions.correctAnswer: false
questions.explanation: Nineveh was a great city of three days' journey.

questions.question: True or False: The king of Nineveh covered himself with sackcloth and sat in ashes after hearing Jonah's message.
questions.correctAnswer: true
questions.explanation: The king humbled himself as an act of repentance.

questions.question: True or False: God destroyed Nineveh despite their repentance.
questions.correctAnswer: false
questions.explanation: God repented of the evil and spared the city.

questions.question: True or False: Jonah was angry because God showed mercy to the people of Nineveh.
questions.correctAnswer: true
questions.explanation: Jonah was very angry about God's mercy.

questions.question: True or False: Jonah built a booth to sit under and watch what would happen to Nineveh.
questions.correctAnswer: true
questions.explanation: Jonah made a booth to observe the city's fate.

questions.question: True or False: The gourd that shaded Jonah grew over many years.
questions.correctAnswer: false
questions.explanation: The gourd grew in a night and perished in a night.
